reviewText: Not easy to get clips from ancient comedy for classroom purposes; most videotape or DVD performances of "Lysistrata" are modernized to the point where you can't use them in a history class, and not much else is available.  So, these excerpts from Aristophanes' "Ecclesiazusae" and Plautus' "Miles Gloriosus" are useful.  No, the acting is not great, but it's passable.
